DataElement.preferredName: Urine Protein Total Excretion Rate Laboratory Procedure Integer::2 Decimal Place Gram per 24 Hours Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The 2 decimal place gram per 24 hours numeric laboratory value measured, assigned or computed related to the assessment of total urinary protein excretion in a specimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The fluid that is excreted by the kidneys.  It is stored in the bladder and discharged through the urethra._Any of a group of complex organic macromolecules that contain carbon, hydrogen, oxygen, nitrogen, and usually sulfur and are composed of one or more chains of amino acids. Proteins are fundamental components of all living cells and include many substances, such as enzymes, hormones, and antibodies, that are necessary for the proper functioning of an organism._Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition._The speed relative to time that an exogenous compound is removed from a body system.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The fluid that is excreted by the kidneys.  It is stored in the bladder and discharged through the urethra.:Any of a group of complex organic macromolecules that contain carbon, hydrogen, oxygen, nitrogen, and usually sulfur and are composed of one or more chains of amino acids. Proteins are fundamental components of all living cells and include many substances, such as enzymes, hormones, and antibodies, that are necessary for the proper functioning of an organism.

Concepts.definition: The fluid that is excreted by the kidneys.  It is stored in the bladder and discharged through the urethra.

A group of complex organic macromolecules composed of one or more chains (linear polymers) of alpha-L-amino acids linked by peptide bonds and ranging in size from a few thousand to over 1 million Daltons. Proteins are fundamental genetically encoded components of living cells with specific structures and functions dictated by amino acid sequence.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete.:The speed relative to time that an exogenous compound is removed from a body system.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
The speed relative to time that an exogenous compound is removed from a body system.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure 2 Decimal Place Gram per 24 Hours Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._A number with no fractional part.::2_An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers._A metric mass flow rate unit equal to the rate at which mass of matter of one gram crosses a given surface or/and is transferred over a period of twenty four hours._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Integer::2 Decimal Place Gram per 24 Hours Value
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.:A number with no fractional part.::2:An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.:A metric mass flow rate unit equal to the rate at which mass of matter of one gram crosses a given surface or/and is transferred over a period of twenty four hours.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.
A metric mass flow rate unit equal to the rate at which mass of matter of one gram crosses a given surface or/and is transferred over a period of twenty four hours.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
